main.title: Festival für unangepasste Kunst
main.description: Experience these highly addictive potato chips

intro.title: An unadjusted festival for unadjusted art
intro.description:
The Festival für Unangepasste Kunst (unadjusted art) is a yearly event in Munich showcasing your not so normal artists. The festival is hosted by german trash art artist ADLER A.F. together with Jessica Petraccaro-Goertsches and several other LMU employees.

During a design workshop at LMU we had the chance to create a mobile application that accompanies the festival. The app containes information about the three weekends covering the topics democracy, power, and participation.

While designing and building the app, we tried to capture the unadjusted atmosphere of the festival and its artists.

main.title: Frozen Sea
main.description: A platform that brings researchers and subjects together

intro.title: Frozen Sea
intro.description:
At the Ludwig-Maximilians University in Munich, every semester countless experiments are conducted. Still, finding subjects for these studies proves to be incredibly difficult. Researchers and subjects have to rely on facebook groups, mailing lists and word of mouth.

To make this process easier for all parties, we created Frozen Sea, a platform to bring researchers and subjects together. Our algorithm takes study requirements into consideration to find suitable subjects.

stat1.title: Create
stat1.description: Create your own experiments on the fly

stat2.title: Participate
stat2.description: Earn study hours, money, or gift cards

stat3.title: Share
stat3.description: Share your experiments on social media

main.title: Buntes Deutschland
main.description: Battle the rise of right wing populism with colorful stickers

intro.title: Buntes Deutschland
intro.description:
Since the fall of 2015 when Germany took in thousands of refugees seeking protection against war, persecution, and torture, right wing populist are on the rise. The likes of Pegida and AfD use the tense situation to agitate against refugees, free media, and liberals in Germany.

Buntes Deutschland (Colorful Germany) is my response to right wing populism and the open display of xenophobia. Like-minded people can use the Buntes Deutschland stickers to set an example for a open, free, and colorful Germany.

intro.title: Social Ride - Mobility means freedom
intro.description:
SocialRide is a non-profit organization trying to help refugees getting started in Munich by providing bicycles free of charge. For us as students, the bike is an essential but affordable means of transportation. That's why we think, the bike is the perfect vehicle for incoming refugees to explore the beautiful Munich.

Since October 2014 we setup our bike workshop in multiple refugee homes giving out free bikes and services. Recently we started offering a new service called Pimp My Bike where we refurbish and sell old bikes together with refugees.

Creating and monitoring the website for SocialRide is both challenging and rewarding. I can use the skills learned at the LMU to help refugees get a head start here in Munich. And most importantly I can work with a great team on hip bicycles.

stat1.title: 200 repaired bikes
stat1.description: Create your own experiments on the fly

stat2.title: 15 refurbished bikes
stat2.description: Earn study hours, money, or gift cards

stat3.title: 40 workshops held
stat3.description: Share your experiments on social media

main.title: TIM One of a kind
main.description: A modern, lightweight project automation platform

intro.title: TIM - a lightweight project automation platform
intro.description:
TIM Solutions, a small software company in the outskirts of Munich, is the first step of my professional career in Germany. After completing my Bachelor's in the spring of 2015, I started as an intern with the goal to develop the new user interface of the web-based process automation tool TIM.

We started the project TIM One of a kind by analyzing the existing GUI of TIM. By asking our customers we realized what works well and what needs to be adjusted in the design.

With a customer-centered approach we made sure to not only design a modern, lightweight application, but to also satisfy the needs of our users.

main.title: Roommate
main.description: A fun, tinder-like way of finding your next roommate or shared apartment

intro.title: Roommate - swipe to your next roommate
intro.description:
I came up with the idea for roommate while looking for a shared apartment in Munich. As it is with many major cities around the world, Munich's real estate market is an urban jungle. This makes finding a place to stay or a new roommate equally painful.

What if you could intelligently match shared appartments with applicants? Similar to Tinder, Roommate brings blabla and shared apartments together.
